file_description: Asset (Money) Laundering Prevention Act, 2008, outlines the legal framework established by Nepal to prevent money laundering and the financing of terrorist activities. It includes definitions, prohibited activities, reporting obligations, penalties, and the roles of various regulatory bodies and institutions.

Bank and Financial Institution Act, 2017, contains Nepal's legislative framework for banks and financial institutions. It aims to regulate their establishment, management, operations, and financial transactions, promoting public trust and financial stability in Nepal's banking sector.

Banking Offence and Punishment Act, 2064 (2008), provides legal provisions to address banking offenses in Nepal, promoting trust in the financial system. It includes definitions of offenses such as unauthorized transactions, misuse of banking resources, and forgery, along with punishments ranging from fines to imprisonment based on the severity of the crime.

This 2007 Act establishes a legal framework to promote fair competition and protect markets in Nepal. It prohibits various anti-competitive practices including anti-competitive agreements, abuse of dominant market position, bid rigging, and misleading advertisements. The Act establishes a Competition Promotion and Market Protection Board to oversee implementation and enforcement, with provisions for investigation, penalties (ranging from 10,000 to 500,000 rupees), and compensation for affected parties.

This Act establishes the legal framework for registering and protecting intellectual property rights in Nepal, specifically patents (for new inventions), designs (for product shapes/forms), and trademarks (for distinctive business identifiers). The Department of Industry handles registrations, with validity periods of 7 years for patents and trademarks and 5 years for designs, all renewable for additional terms. The Act includes provisions for penalties for unauthorized use, with fines ranging from 50,000 to 500,000 Rupees plus confiscation of related goods.
